TF038816-BOSNIA - SUPERVISION OF POWER
            SECTOR PROJECTS,TF039744-BOSNIA-HERZEGOVINA - THIRD
            ELECTRIC POWER RECONSTRUCTION PROJECT,TF039162-BOSNIA-HERZEGOVINA - THIRD
            ELECTRIC POWER RECONSTRUCTION,TF037343-BOSNIA-HERZEGOVINA - ELEC. PWR.
            III RECN.,TF036769-BOSNIA-HERZEGOVINA - THIRD
            ELECTRIC POWER PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The environmental assessment examines
            the potential adverse effect on the environment, resulting
            from the implementation of the Third Electric Power Project.
            Water, air, and noise pollution will occur, as a result of
            electrostatic dust discharges, gas emissions, oil leakage,
            and vibration disturbances during construction. Mitigating
            measures include: 1) the construction of oil pits, and use
            of oil transformers, - toxic-free - to control oil spillage;
            2) the use of protective, noise abatement devices by
            construction workers, as well as setting time limits on
            working schedules, based on common day-time working hours.
            Additionally, noise measuring instruments should be
            provided; 3) controlled deforestation practices, in
            accordance with the country's laws, and regulations, to
            be followed by afforestation practices; 4) access
            interception to areas close to transmission lines, to avoid
            potential electro magnetic radiation effects; and, 5)
            regulation enforcement regarding sludge collection, for
            disposal into waste water treatment plants.
